item.title: Is pure democracy fair?
item.dc:creator: @R.I.P_RSC R.I.P RSC
item.description:
@R.I.P_RSC wrote:

All political systems are as good as it’s weakest links. Which is why, from a Communist point of view, it’s good to get rid of people not cooperating. Same applies to a democracy, although the politicians don’t have enough power to get rid of their enemies. In an ideal world, I’d prefer Anarchy. But Anarchy depends heavily on the people, and as soon as someone starts to abuse the system it will degrade.

Democracy isn’t fair, as 51% rules over 49%. I see it in the Netherlands. Our current right wing government has 76 seats, out of 150. That’s one more than the mostly left opposition has. This results in politicians lying even more than before. A few months after the parliamentary elections, we elected the senate. In those few months, our government came up with a lot of rubbish plans to get a lot of votes. For instance, they started testing whether our maximum speed should be increased from 120km/h to 130km/h. After the elections for the senate, they came to the conclusion that it’s a bad idea. And they also decided to cut the budget…
